strengths: All three iter-2 weaknesses resolved: agent-level validation in validate.ts:186-239 with 5 tests, runtime integrity via parseSynthesisReport in audit-loader.ts:77, prettier 100% -- compound learning loop working as intended.

Verification pipeline end-to-end: tsconfig strict+noUncheckedIndexedAccess+noImplicitReturns, validateSynthesisReport with per-agent field validation, error boundaries at 3 route levels, PostToolUse prettier hook, CI pipeline tsc->lint->prettier->tests->build.

Clean architecture decomposition: types.ts (386 lines, single source of truth), validate.ts (335 lines, pure validation), audit-loader.ts (113 lines, dual data resolution), messages.ts (centralized strings) -- each module has one responsibility and composes well.
weaknesses: audit-loader.ts getProjectState/getTimeline/getActionItems use bare JSON.parse-as-cast without validation -- only getAudit uses parseSynthesisReport. 3 of 5 data loading functions bypass the validation system.
Error boundary UI strings hardcoded in error.tsx files rather than using the centralized messages.ts pattern -- breaks the string extraction discipline.

VERDICT_STYLES and formatTimestamp duplicated across results/page.tsx, results/[auditId]/page.tsx, and AgentCard.tsx -- three separate copies with style drift (ring-based vs border-based verdict badges).

strengths: Closed-loop improvement story proven with real data across 3 iterations (68.4 to 83.5) -- the tool demonstrably improves the thing it evaluates, creating a compelling before-and-after narrative.
Landing page has coherent user journey: hero tagline, demo video (32MB mp4), install section, how-it-works steps, agent showcase, and feature grid with centralized i18n-ready strings in messages.ts.

Audit detail page delivers genuine interactive value: radar charts, score progression with target reference lines, divergent opinions between agents, per-agent score bars with verdict badges, and prioritized action items.
weaknesses: Landing page install section (messages.ts:32) still shows 'claude plugin add boardclaude' as primary command, inconsistent with README which correctly leads with manual git clone + cp. Website visitors see a non-functional install path first.

boardclaude.com remains a showcase site -- visitors see self-audit data but cannot interact meaningfully without installing the CLI plugin. No sandbox, no interactive panel builder, no 'try it now' experience.
Manual install path requires copying 6 directories into user's project, polluting their workspace. No install script, no npx one-liner, no symlink approach.

strengths: Genuinely novel recursive self-evaluation architecture proven across 3 iterations (68.4 to 83.5) with audit-fix-validate-re-audit closed loop -- this is not a wrapper but a compound intelligence system that demonstrably gets better with each cycle.

Agent Teams architecture with heterogeneous model routing: Opus with effort=max for deep reasoning (Boris, Thariq), Opus effort=high for nuanced evaluation (Cat, Lydia), Sonnet effort=medium for structured tasks (Ado, Jason) -- genuine model-capability alignment.

End-to-end validated pipeline from agent output through parseSynthesisReport runtime validation to production dashboard at boardclaude.com with error boundaries at every route -- feedback loop extends to production via Vercel auto-deploy.
weaknesses: Extended thinking effort levels (max/high/medium) lack empirical A/B measurement -- no comparison showing effort=max produces measurably different evaluations than effort=high for the same agent.
1M token context window underutilized: no cross-iteration context loading. Each audit iteration starts fresh rather than loading previous full audit JSONs for progressive trend analysis.
Agent debate remains emergent not structured: divergent opinions discovered post-hoc by synthesis rather than through deliberate multi-round debate between disagreeing agents.

strengths: TypeScript configuration textbook-strict: strict:true, noUncheckedIndexedAccess, noImplicitReturns. Only one any in entire codebase (RadarChart.tsx:55) properly documented with eslint-disable and immediately narrowed.

Complete error boundary hierarchy at every route segment: app/error.tsx, results/error.tsx, results/[auditId]/error.tsx -- each with contextual messages, recovery buttons, and navigation. Loading skeletons match page structure to prevent CLS.
All three iter-2 weaknesses verifiably resolved: ListSection uses key={item} not index, ScoreProgression uses useReducedMotion from framer-motion, [auditId] error boundary now exists.
weaknesses: VERDICT_STYLES defined 3x across AgentCard.tsx:26, results/page.tsx:27, results/[auditId]/page.tsx:21 with style drift (ring-based vs border-based). formatTimestamp duplicated 3x with slightly different format options.
RadarChart and ScoreProgression statically imported -- not lazy-loaded with next/dynamic. Heavy Recharts+Framer Motion client bundle included even when components conditionally render.
No test coverage for ScoreProgression component despite having the most complex rendering logic (useMemo, useCallback, custom tooltip, conditional empty state).

strengths: LICENSE file now present at repo root -- full community docs complete: CONTRIBUTING.md (64 lines), CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md (Contributor Covenant 2.1), issue templates for bugs and features, CI pipeline visible.

Outstanding accessibility implementation: useReducedMotion in AgentCard and ScoreProgression, comprehensive aria-labels on charts, role='img' and role='list', focus-visible rings on interactive elements.
Exemplary documentation: README (166 lines) with quickstart, architecture diagram, agent table, custom panel YAML example, examples/audit-example.json, JSDoc on components, 4 panel templates.
weaknesses: No CHANGELOG.md despite version references (v0.1.0, v0.2.0 in CLAUDE.md and git tags) -- developers expect a changelog for versioned projects.
No visual assets (screenshots, GIFs) in README. Dashboard is the visual centerpiece but README is entirely text-based.
Manual install requires 6 cp commands -- functional but error-prone. No install script to automate.

strengths: Outstanding community architecture: 5 shareable panel templates in panels/templates/, YAML configs designed for sharing, CONTRIBUTING.md with clear panel creation guide, CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md establishing inclusive environment.
Exceptional narrative quality: one-sentence pitch immediately clear to non-developers, compelling before/after in Example Output section, live demo at boardclaude.com with 3 real audit iterations.
Production-ready integration: CI/CD pipeline runs tsc/ESLint/Prettier/tests/build on every push, error boundaries at all route levels, 37/37 tests passing, plugin manifest with standard interfaces.
weaknesses: Internationalization remains the critical gap: all date formatters hardcode 'en-US' locale (results/page.tsx:18, results/[auditId]/page.tsx:31, ScoreProgression.tsx:46), Inter font loads only 'latin' subset, error boundary strings hardcoded in JSX.
Accessibility gaps: no skip-to-content link for keyboard users, no aria-live regions for dynamic content updates, lang attribute hardcoded to 'en' with no mechanism to change it.
Install friction with 6 directory copies required -- functional but not product-quality onboarding.

top_strengths: All iteration-2 action items resolved and verified: agent-level validation with 5 tests, key={item} fix, useReducedMotion consistency, [auditId] error boundary, prettier 100%, LICENSE added -- compound learning loop proven across 4 iterations (cited by Boris, Lydia, Ado, Thariq)

End-to-end verification pipeline complete: TypeScript strict mode with noUncheckedIndexedAccess, runtime schema validation via parseSynthesisReport, error boundaries at 3 route levels, CI pipeline with 5 quality gates, 37/37 tests passing -- zero errors across all tooling (cited by Boris, Lydia, Jason)

Production-ready documentation and accessibility: LICENSE, README, CONTRIBUTING.md, CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md, issue templates, JSDoc, 4 panel templates, useReducedMotion, aria-labels, role attributes, focus-visible rings -- community infrastructure complete (cited by Ado, Jason, Lydia)
top_weaknesses: Manual installation friction persists for 3rd consecutive iteration: 6 directory copies with no install script or automation, website shows non-functional 'claude plugin add' as primary install command (cited by Cat, Ado, Jason)

Code duplication across dashboard: VERDICT_STYLES duplicated 3x with style drift, formatTimestamp duplicated 3x with different format options, error boundary strings hardcoded outside messages.ts pattern (cited by Boris, Lydia, Jason)

Internationalization remains the weakest dimension: all date formatters hardcode 'en-US', Inter font latin-only subset, no i18n library wired to messages.ts extraction -- Jason's i18n score at 52/100 is lowest individual criterion across all agents (cited by Jason, Cat)

agent_a.position: STRONG_PASS (93.9) -- documentation infrastructure is nearly complete, community readiness is high with LICENSE, CONTRIBUTING.md, issue templates, and exemplary README

agent_b.position: PASS (81.1) -- adoption funnel has a critical gap: website shows non-functional install command, no interactive value for visitors who haven't installed, manual install is high-friction

divergent_opinions.analysis: Ado evaluates documentation completeness for developers who have already found the project. Cat evaluates the discovery-to-first-value journey for developers who haven't committed yet. Both are correct: the docs are excellent once you're in, but the path to getting in has friction. Cat's concern is more urgent since it directly blocks the user acquisition funnel.

agent_a.position: STRONG_PASS (87.35) but emergent_behavior at 82 -- wants structured multi-round debate between agents before synthesis, cross-iteration context loading, empirical thinking-depth measurement

agent_b.position: STRONG_PASS (88.0) with compound_learning at 89 -- clean architecture with validated data flow already delivers 15.1-point improvement across iterations; structured debate adds complexity risk

divergent_opinions.analysis: Thariq pushes toward demonstrating what multi-agent AI can uniquely do (structured debate, progressive context). Boris values the proven architecture that already works. For hackathon judging, Boris's position is stronger: the 15.1-point improvement is concrete evidence of value. Structured debate is a compelling post-launch feature but adds risk to a working system.

action_items.action: Create install.sh at repo root that automates the 6-directory copy with validation and clear output. Update README and website install section to use it.
action_items.impact: Unblocks adoption for all external users -- most-cited weakness across 3 agents

action_items.action: Sync landing page install section (messages.ts:32) with README: lead with manual clone + install.sh, show 'claude plugin add' as coming soon
action_items.impact: Fixes most visible user-facing inconsistency between website and README

action_items.action: Extract VERDICT_STYLES, GRADE_STYLES, formatTimestamp to shared dashboard/src/lib/ui-constants.ts, import from all 3 usage sites
action_items.impact: Eliminates triple duplication and style drift, enforces single source of truth

action_items.action: Move all error boundary strings to messages.ts with errors namespace to complete string centralization pattern
action_items.impact: Restores consistency with extraction pattern, enables future i18n

action_items.action: Add validation for ProjectState, Timeline, and ActionItemsLedger JSON loading in audit-loader.ts instead of bare as-cast
action_items.impact: Closes remaining data integrity gap -- 3 of 5 loaders currently bypass validation

action_items.action: Lazy-load RadarChart and ScoreProgression with next/dynamic({ ssr: false }) to reduce audit detail route bundle size
action_items.impact: Improves LCP/TTI by deferring heavy Recharts+Framer Motion client bundle

action_items.action: Add ScoreProgression.test.tsx covering empty state, sorted data, reduced motion, custom tooltip, and target reference line
action_items.impact: Closes biggest gap in component test coverage

action_items.action: Replace hardcoded 'en-US' in all formatTimestamp functions with browser locale (undefined or navigator.language)
action_items.impact: Users in non-US locales see dates in their native format -- low effort, high signal for global readiness

action_items.action: Add CHANGELOG.md with versioned entries for iterations 0-3
action_items.impact: Meets developer expectations for versioned projects, builds trust

action_items.action: Add 3-4 screenshots to README: dashboard overview, radar chart, agent cards, score progression
action_items.impact: Visual proof of the product -- highest-impact README improvement for first impressions

improvements: Boris: +3.5 (84.5 -> 88.0) -- all iter-2 weaknesses resolved, agent-level validation with 5 tests, prettier 100%
Ado: +4.6 (89.3 -> 93.9) -- LICENSE added resolving critical issue, community docs complete
Lydia: +2.55 (83.3 -> 85.85) -- key={item} fix, useReducedMotion consistency, [auditId] error boundary added
Thariq: +1.9 (85.45 -> 87.35) -- proven 3-iteration loop strengthens innovation claim
Cat: +1.95 (79.15 -> 81.1) -- coherent landing page journey, real data in dashboard
Jason: +2.0 (79.85 -> 81.85) -- production deployment, improved narrative, better error handling
